2025-07-16.content: You can [disable the built-in `run.app` URL](https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/securing/ingress) of a Cloud Run service to ensure that traffic can only ingress through paths that you've explicitly configured ([GA](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages)).

summary.title: Cloud Run: Disable built-in `run.app` URL
summary.summary: You can now disable the built-in `run.app` URL for your Cloud Run services. This allows you to control traffic ingress more granularly, ensuring it only passes through your configured paths. This feature is now generally available.

2025-07-15.content:
Compute flexible committed use discounts (CUDs) have expanded to also cover your Cloud Billing account's spend across Cloud Run services with request-based billing and Cloud Run functions.

The [improved spend-based CUD experience](https://cloud.google.com/docs/cuds-multiprice) is available without requiring an opt-in for new users or users who don't have an active spend-based CUD.

To learn more about how opting into the new model affects your flexible CUDs, see [Committed use discounts](https://cloud.google.com/run/cud).

summary.title: Flexible CUDs now cover Cloud Run
summary.summary: You can now use flexible committed use discounts to cover your Cloud Billing account's spend on Cloud Run services with request-based billing and Cloud Run functions. This feature is automatically available for new users and those without active spend-based CUDs.

summary.title: Go 1.24 runtime support in preview
summary.summary: Google Cloud Run now supports the Go 1.24 runtime in preview. This update allows developers to leverage the latest features and improvements in the Go programming language for their serverless applications.

2025-06-30.content: You can [apply maximum instance configuration](https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/configuring/max-instances#service-vs-revision-level) at the service level (in Preview).

summary.title: Maximum instance configuration at service level
summary.summary: You can now set the maximum instance configuration at the service level. This feature is currently in Preview.

2025-06-25.content: Cloud Run [worker pools](https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/deploy-worker-pools) are now available (Preview). Worker pools are specifically designed for non-request workloads.

summary.title: Cloud Run worker pools now available in preview
summary.summary: Cloud Run worker pools are now available in preview. This feature is designed for non-request driven workloads.

2025-06-24.content: A new region is now available for [Cloud Run GPUs](https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/configuring/services/gpu#supported-regions): `us-east4`.

summary.title: New region available for Cloud Run GPUs
summary.summary: A new region, us-east4, is now available for Cloud Run GPUs.

2025-06-17.content: Support for the [PHP 8.4 runtime](https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/runtime-support#php) is in [General Availability (GA)](https://cloud.google.com/products/?_gl=1*dplot*_ga*MTM2MDk5MzEzMi4xNzQ1ODg0OTY5*_ga_4LYFWVHBEB*MTc0NjE0MTA3Ny4yMi4xLjE3NDYxNDEwOTYuMC4wLjA.#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: PHP 8.4 runtime now available on Cloud Run
summary.summary: PHP 8.4 runtime is now generally available on Google Cloud Run, offering enhanced features and performance for your applications.

2025-06-17.content: Support for the [Ruby 3.4 runtime](https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/runtime-support#ruby) is in [General Availability (GA)](https://cloud.google.com/products/?_gl=1*dplot*_ga*MTM2MDk5MzEzMi4xNzQ1ODg0OTY5*_ga_4LYFWVHBEB*MTc0NjE0MTA3Ny4yMi4xLjE3NDYxNDEwOTYuMC4wLjA.#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Ruby 3.4 runtime now available
summary.summary: Ruby 3.4 runtime is now generally available in Google Cloud Run, offering improved performance and features.

2025-06-16.content: You can [configure GPU](https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/configuring/jobs/gpu) in your Cloud Run job (Preview).

summary.title: Configure GPU in Cloud Run Jobs
summary.summary: You can now configure GPUs in your Cloud Run jobs to run even more demanding workloads.

2025-06-09.content: You can [use request host and request path in IAM Conditions](https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/securing/managing-access#conditions) when defining access control for invoking Cloud Run services.

summary.title: IAM Conditions for Cloud Run
summary.summary: You can now use request host and request path in IAM Conditions to manage access control for your Cloud Run services. This provides more granular control over who can invoke your services.

2025-05-30.content:
For Java Cloud Run functions that use `functions-framework` version 1.4.0 or later, you
can now use the logging class `java.util.logging.Logger` to add a [unique execution
ID](https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/runtimes/java#execution_id) to log outputs.

summary.title: Execution ID logging for Java Cloud Run
summary.summary: You can now add a unique execution ID to your Java Cloud Run function logs using the `java.util.logging.Logger` class. This feature is available for functions using `functions-framework` version 1.4.0 and later.

2025-05-28.content: Multiple regions now benefit from enhanced responsiveness for latency-sensitive applications for [Cloud Run service URLs](https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/triggering/https-request#url).

summary.title: Enhanced Responsiveness for Cloud Run Service URLs
summary.summary: Latency-sensitive applications using Cloud Run service URLs now have improved responsiveness across multiple regions.
